dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Apple Inc. (AAPL)’s Struggle: Can AI Help Regain Market Share in 2025?
News Content: We recently published a list of 15 Important AI News and Ratings on Investors’ Radar. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) stands against other important AI news and ratings on investors’ radar.

On Monday, the US government revealed that it would further restrict artificial intelligence chip and technology exports. As reported by Reuters, the goal behind these restrictions is to help the US advance its computing power and AI technology, while finding more ways to block China’s access. Under the new regulations, the number of AI chips exported to most countries will be capped, allowing unlimited access to U.S. AI technology for America’s closest allies. Meanwhile, a block shall be maintained on exports to China, Russia, Iran, and North Korea.

“The U.S. leads AI now – both AI development and AI chip design, and it’s critical that we keep it that way”.

READ NOW: Top 10 AI Stocks on Wall Street’s Radar and 10 Buzzing AI Stocks on Latest News and Ratings

These regulations are seemingly the last efforts by the Biden administration to maintain US leadership in AI and close any loopholes in controlling the flow of AI chips. The new administration, set to take office on January 20, shares similar views on the competitive threat from China. However, President-elect Donald Trump is expected to make significant changes to the Biden administration’s stance on artificial intelligence.

“We will repeal Joe Biden’s dangerous Executive Order that hinders AI innovation, and imposes radical leftwing ideas on the development of this technology. In its place, Republicans support AI development rooted in free speech and human flourishing”.

With only a few days left until Trump takes office, the recently revealed restrictions on AI chips have been imposed on advanced graphics processing units (GPUs), which are used to power data centers needed to train AI models. Moreover, under the new rules, cloud providers will be able to build data centers by applying for global approval. Once approved, they won’t need export licenses for AI chips which will allow them to build data centers in countries that cannot import enough chips because of the U.S.-imposed quotas. However, these authorized companies must abide by stringent conditions and restrictions, such as security requirements, reporting demands, and a plan or track record of respecting human rights.

Currently, the recent regulation divides the world into three tiers. 18 countries, including Japan, Britain, South Korea, and the Netherlands, will essentially be exempt from the rules. Moreover, 120 other countries, including Singapore, Israel, Saudi Arabia, and the United Arab Emirates, will face country caps, whereas arms-embargoed countries like Russia, China, and Iran will not be allowed to receive the technology altogether.

Story Continues

“How effective the rule ends up being in the next 10 to 15 years is now up to the incoming team. They are well aware that ensuring a dominant domestic industry is a core element of competition with China”.

For this article, we selected AI stocks by going through news articles, stock analysis, and press releases. These stocks are also popular among hedge funds.

Why are we interested in the stocks that hedge funds pile into? The reason is simple: our research has shown that we can outperform the market by imitating the top stock picks of the best hedge funds. Our quarterly newsletter’s strategy selects 14 small-cap and large-cap stocks every quarter and has returned 275% since May 2014, beating its benchmark by 150 percentage points (see more details here).Apple Inc. (AAPL)'s Struggle: Can AI Help Regain Market Share in 2025?

A wide view of an Apple store, showing the range of products the company offers.

Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL)

Number of Hedge Fund Holders: 158

Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is a technology company. Recently, the company has had underwhelming upgrades and competitors that have led the iPhone maker to lose market share in the final quarter of 2024. Bloomberg cited research by Counterpoint Research data, stating how the iPhone’s market share slipped a point to 18% worldwide in 2024. As per the research, the company marked a 2% sales decline for the full year, while the wider market grew 4% globally.

On the other hand, Android device makers from China, led by Xiaomi Corp. and Vivo, have been gaining strength in the region. Since Apple’s new artificial intelligence suite isn’t available in China, the lack of AI availability has hindered its performance in the region. The company is currently striving to partner up with local players to provide features such as AI writing assistance and image generation. Nevertheless, Apple’s AI hasn’t been all the rage, either.

“Apple’s iPhone 16 series was met with a mixed response, partly due to a lack of availability of Apple Intelligence at launch. However, Apple continued to grow strongly in its noncore markets like Latin America”.

Overall, AAPL ranks 2nd on our list of important AI news and ratings on investors’ radar. While we acknowledge the potential of AAPL as an investment, our conviction lies in the belief that some AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns and doing so within a shorter timeframe. If you are looking for an AI stock that is more promising than AAPL but that trades at less than 5 times its earnings, check out our report about the cheapest AI stock.

READ NEXT: 8 Best Wide Moat Stocks to Buy Now and 30 Most Important AI Stocks According to BlackRock

Disclosure: None. This article is originally published at Insider Monkey.

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news headline relates to luxury stocks, and while Apple Inc. is not exclusively a luxury brand, its products are often priced at a premium. The discussion around luxury stocks might indicate positive sentiment in high-end consumer spending, which could indirectly benefit Apple. However, the headline does not provide direct information about Apple and leaves room for uncertainty concerning its specific impact on AAPL stock. Hence, there is a moderate probability of the stock price rising, but also some chance of it falling depending on broader market reactions to luxury spending trends.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple (AAPL). Positively, Apple ranks 2nd on the list of important AI news and ratings and continues to grow strongly in non-core markets like Latin America. However, the headline suggests a struggle for Apple to regain market share. The iPhone maker has lost market share in the final quarter and faces challenges due to the lack of AI availability in China, which has impacted performance in that region, and a mixed response to the iPhone 16 series due to limited availability of Apple Intelligence. Additionally, competitors in China are gaining strength. The article also highlights governmental regulations impacting AI chip exports, which could indirectly affect Apple's AI development and market position, though those are longer term impacts. The article suggests, the US government is prioritizing AI leadership which could favor US companies, but the incoming administration of Donald Trump is expected to make significant changes that may affect AI innovation, with policy potentially moving towards more open AI development, which may or may not benefit Apple. Considering all these factors, there is a slightly higher probability of a stock price fall than rise.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The article focuses on the potential for Amazon (AMZN) to become the first $5 trillion company, arguing against Nvidia and downplaying Apple's prospects.  The argument rests on several points: 1) The potential bursting of the AI bubble will negatively impact Nvidia and Microsoft, which are heavily invested in AI. 2) While Apple is strong, its valuation is already high, leaving little room for the massive growth needed to hit $5 trillion. 3) Amazon's diverse revenue streams, particularly AWS's dominant position in the cloud computing market,  combined with its relatively inexpensive valuation compared to its historical multiples, position it for substantial future growth.  The article is bullish on Amazon and implicitly bearish on Apple and Nvidia. However, the prediction is speculative and based on macroeconomic assumptions and historical analogies, not on specific financial details about Apple.  The impact on Apple's stock price from this news is therefore likely to be muted.  While the article suggests that Apple is less likely to reach a $5 trillion valuation than Amazon, it doesn't provide specific reasons why Apple's stock price should rise or fall directly as a result of the opinion piece.  The possibility of a market reaction to the overall sentiment of the article against the AI market is possible, but I'm assuming the impact on AAPL will be small.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news article highlights Apple's strong competitive advantages, including its innovation, brand loyalty, and significant market share in consumer electronics and services. It also mentions Apple's expansion into AI and its growing services revenue, which are seen as new growth opportunities. The article acknowledges that while Apple may not offer the same explosive growth as newer companies, its established market dominance and financial strength position it well for steady future gains. Given the positive tone of the article and the emphasis on Apple's strengths and growth potential, the stock is likely to be viewed favorably by investors.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.05, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.05, Reasoning: The news headline 'Investing in Luxury Stocks' does not directly mention Apple Inc. (AAPL) or provide specific information about the company's performance, products, or financials. Luxury stocks are often associated with high-end brands, and while Apple is a luxury tech brand, the headline lacks specificity. As a result, it's unlikely to have a significant direct impact on Apple's stock price. Therefore, I estimate that the probability of the stock price rising due to this news is low, and the probability of it falling is also low, with a slight bias towards the stock price remaining stable or being influenced by other market factors.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The article discusses Apple's strong competitive advantage, earnings growth, and innovative products, which have contributed to its position as the world's largest company. The company's expansion into services revenue and AI could power a new phase of growth. While the article suggests that Apple may not deliver the same growth as younger companies, its dominance and strong moat make it a compelling buy for most investors. Based on this analysis, the probability of the stock price rising is higher than falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The financial news highlights a prediction that the first $5 trillion company on Wall Street will not be Nvidia but might be Amazon instead. The article suggests Amazon has strong ancillary operating segments, including AWS, which provides substantial growth potential beyond AI. Additionally, Amazon is described as historically inexpensive compared to its past multiples, suggesting room for valuation increase. These factors suggest positive developments for Amazon which might influence investors favorably.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news headline focuses on luxury stocks, which indirectly relates to Apple's positioning as a premium brand. While not explicitly negative, the headline lacks direct information about Apple, leading to uncertainty. Analysis of previous predictions indicates a mix of positive sentiment about Apple's brand and growth potential, but also highlights concerns regarding market share and AI competition. Thus, moderate probabilities are assigned for stock price movements, factoring in both potential benefits of increased luxury spending and the uncertain market outlook for Apple.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The article presents a mixed outlook for Apple. The negative aspects include: Struggle to regain market share, lost market share in the final quarter of 2024, AI unavailability in China hindering performance, mixed response to iPhone 16 due to lack of Apple Intelligence, and strong competition from Chinese Android device makers. The positive aspects: Rank 2nd on the list of important AI news and ratings and strong growth in non-core markets like Latin America. Additionally, government regulations restricting AI chip exports could have varied affects. Finally, the uncertainty stemming from the upcoming change in administration adds another element of unpredictability. Overall, the mixed bag of positive and negative news, combined with regulatory uncertainties, makes a short-term prediction challenging. Based on the trends given by others, I will lower the chance of stock price rising.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The article focuses on Amazon's potential to become the first $5 trillion company, implicitly suggesting that Apple's chances are lower.  While the article highlights Apple's strengths and growth in services, it also points out its high valuation, leaving limited room for significant further growth.  The prediction that an AI bubble might burst is negative for AI-heavy companies like Nvidia and Microsoft, but the impact on Apple is less direct, given its diversified revenue streams.  Previous predictions are mixed, with probabilities of a price rise ranging from 0.05 to 0.7. Considering the article's relatively neutral stance on Apple and the diverse opinions in the previous round,  a neutral stance seems most appropriate. The likelihood of a significant price movement based solely on this article appears low. The relatively high valuation of Apple already factors in much of its positive outlook.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news article provides a comprehensive analysis of Apple Inc.'s strengths, including its strong competitive advantage, innovation, brand loyalty, and significant market share in consumer electronics and services. It highlights Apple's expansion into AI and growing services revenue as new growth opportunities. The article acknowledges that while Apple may not offer the same explosive growth as newer companies, its established market dominance and financial strength position it well for steady future gains. The positive tone of the article and the emphasis on Apple's strengths and growth potential suggest that the stock is likely to be viewed favorably by investors. Previous predictions also lean towards a higher probability of the stock price rising, with most models estimating a 0.6 to 0.7 probability of a rise. Considering these factors, the probability of the stock price rising is higher than falling.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news headline 'Investing in Luxury Stocks' does not directly mention Apple Inc. (AAPL) or provide specific information about the company's performance, products, or financials. However, considering Apple is often associated with luxury tech products, there might be an indirect positive sentiment. Various models provided different predictions based on their analysis of Apple's position in the market, its competitive advantages, and potential for growth. The predictions range from a very positive outlook (with probabilities of rising as high as 0.7) to a more neutral or slightly negative outlook (with probabilities of rising as low as 0.05). Given the lack of direct information in the headline and the mixed predictions from various models, a moderate approach seems reasonable. The average prediction from the models suggests a slightly higher probability of the stock price rising than falling, but with significant uncertainty.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news article presents a positive outlook for Apple, highlighting its strong competitive advantage, earnings growth, and innovative products. The company's expansion into services revenue and AI could power a new phase of growth. Additionally, the article suggests that Apple's dominance and strong moat make it a compelling buy for most investors. Considering the previous predictions from other models, there is a general trend towards a positive outlook for Apple's stock price, with some models predicting a higher probability of the stock price rising. However, it's essential to note that the stock market can be unpredictable, and various factors can influence the stock price. Based on the analysis, I estimate that the probability of the stock price rising is higher than falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The financial news primarily discusses potential $5 trillion market capitalization candidates, focusing on Amazon as a likely contender. Apple is mentioned with a generally positive tone, highlighting its market share, competitive advantages, and services revenue potential. However, there's an implication that Apple might not have the room for the tremendous growth needed to achieve a $5 trillion valuation relative to Amazon's growth potential in areas like AWS. The overall sentiment towards Apple is moderately positive but with a slight caution regarding its high valuation. The news could lead to a temporary positive sentiment but with underlying concerns affecting long-term expectations.
Round: 2
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news headline about investing in luxury stocks suggests a potential positive association with Apple, given its premium status in consumer electronics. However, the analysis from previous predictions reflects a mixed sentiment towards Apple's stock, considering factors such as competition, market share challenges, and regulatory issues affecting AI development. While many models lean toward a positive view of Apple's innovative strengths and market position, concerns about high valuation and competition temper this sentiment. The predictions suggest a moderate chance of rising stock prices, counterbalanced by uncertainties in the market. Therefore, I estimate a slightly higher probability for the stock price rising compared to falling.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple. The headline and article focus on Apple's struggle to regain market share and the importance of AI in achieving this. There are several negative points: Apple lost market share in the final quarter of 2024, faces challenges due to lack of AI availability in China, and the iPhone 16 had a mixed reception. However, there are also positive points: Apple ranks highly on the list of important AI news and ratings, and shows strong growth in non-core markets like Latin America. Furthermore, government regulations on AI chip exports could affect the company in unpredictable ways, and the upcoming change in presidential administration adds another layer of uncertainty regarding the AI landscape. Considering that most of the previous predictions lean towards slight rise, but the article is slightly negative I weight my prediction towards a fall, with a lower expectation of rise.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article focuses on Amazon's potential to become the first $5 trillion company, indirectly suggesting a less bullish outlook for Apple. While acknowledging Apple's strengths (services growth, brand loyalty), the article highlights its already high valuation, limiting room for massive growth needed to reach $5 trillion.  The potential bursting of the AI bubble is presented as a risk for AI-focused companies like Nvidia and Microsoft, but the impact on Apple is considered less direct due to its diversified revenue streams.  The previous predictions are mixed, with probabilities of a price rise ranging widely (0.05 to 0.7). Considering the article's somewhat neutral stance on Apple and the diversity in prior predictions, a neutral-to-slightly bearish stance is warranted.  While Apple's fundamentals remain strong, the article's focus on Amazon and the potential AI bubble dampens the immediate bullish outlook.  The high valuation already accounts for much of the positive outlook, hence the relatively low probability of a substantial price increase.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news article provides a generally positive outlook on Apple Inc. (AAPL), emphasizing its strong competitive advantages, consistent earnings growth, and innovative product lineup. It highlights Apple's expansion into services and AI as significant growth drivers, which could attract investor interest. However, the article also acknowledges that Apple may not offer the same explosive growth as newer or AI-focused companies like Nvidia, which could temper some optimism. Previous predictions from other models show a range of opinions, with most leaning towards a higher probability of the stock price rising (probabilities ranging from 0.55 to 0.7), but with some uncertainty due to market dynamics and valuation concerns. Considering the overall positive sentiment of the article and the mixed but generally favorable previous predictions, I estimate a slightly higher probability of the stock price rising than falling.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news headline 'Investing in Luxury Stocks' indirectly relates to Apple Inc. as a premium brand. Previous predictions from various models show a mixed outlook, with probabilities of the stock price rising ranging from 0.05 to 0.7. The general trend suggests a slightly higher probability of the stock price rising than falling, driven by Apple's strong competitive advantages, innovation, brand loyalty, and growth potential in services and AI. However, concerns about market share, AI competition, and high valuation contribute to uncertainty. Considering these factors, a moderate approach seems reasonable.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news article provides a positive outlook for Apple, highlighting its strong competitive advantage, earnings growth, and innovative products. The company's expansion into services revenue and AI could power a new phase of growth. Additionally, the article suggests that Apple's dominance and strong moat make it a compelling buy for most investors. Based on the analysis, I estimate that the probability of the stock price rising is higher than falling.

Apple is mentioned with a generally positive tone, highlighting its market share, competitive advantages, and services revenue potential. However, there's an implication that Apple might not have the room for the tremendous growth needed to achieve a $5 trillion valuation relative to Amazon's growth potential in areas like AWS. The overall sentiment towards Apple is moderately positive but with a slight caution regarding its high valuation. The news could lead to a temporary positive sentiment but with underlying concerns affecting long-term expectations.
Round: 3
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news headline 'Investing in Luxury Stocks' indirectly relates to Apple Inc. due to its positioning as a premium brand in consumer electronics. While there is generally positive sentiment around Apple's brand and product loyalty, previous analyses reveal mixed factors affecting its stock price, including struggles with market share and increased competition, particularly in AI. Despite these challenges, many predictions suggest a moderate probability of the stock price rising due to ongoing growth in services and a strong market position. The net effect of these considerations leans towards a higher likelihood of the stock price rising compared to falling, albeit with significant uncertainty in the market context.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news headline indicates a struggle for Apple to regain market share, focusing on the role of AI. The article highlights both positive and negative aspects for Apple. On the negative side, Apple lost market share, faces challenges in China due to AI unavailability, and the iPhone 16 had a mixed response. On the positive side, Apple has a high AI news ranking and shows growth in Latin America. The governmental regulations regarding AI chips and potential administration changes add further uncertainty. The previous rounds show a mixed trend, with varying models leaning towards either a slight rise or fall. Considering the headline's focus on a struggle and the mixed news, a slightly higher probability of a stock price fall seems reasonable.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news article focuses on Amazon's potential to become the first $5 trillion company, indirectly comparing it to Apple, Microsoft, and Nvidia. While acknowledging Apple's strengths (Services segment growth, strong brand), the article highlights its already high valuation, suggesting limited room for substantial further growth needed to reach that $5 trillion mark. This presents a somewhat negative sentiment towards Apple's potential for massive future gains, though not directly negative towards its current position.  The prediction of a potential AI bubble burst is considered a threat primarily for AI-focused companies like Nvidia and Microsoft.  Apple's diversified revenue streams somewhat mitigate this risk.  Previous predictions from various models show a wide range (0.05 to 0.7) for the probability of a stock price rise. Considering the article's relatively neutral-to-slightly bearish stance on Apple's future growth potential compared to Amazon and the dispersed previous predictions, a probability closer to the lower end of the previous predictions is warranted. The high valuation of Apple stock already reflects much of its positive outlook. Therefore, the likelihood of a significant price movement based solely on this article is considered low, leaning slightly towards a fall.

The article acknowledges that while Apple may not offer the same explosive growth as newer companies, its established market dominance and financial strength position it well for steady future gains. The positive tone of the article and the emphasis on Apple's strengths and growth potential suggest that the stock is likely to be viewed favorably by investors. Considering the overall positive sentiment of the article and the mixed but generally favorable previous predictions, I estimate a slightly higher probability of the stock price rising than falling. The article highlights potential growth opportunities in Amazon's revenue streams and its relatively cheaper valuation compared to its historical averages, thereby indirectly casting doubts on Apple's growth prospects. The overall sentiment leans towards a cautious stance with regard to Apple's immediate prospects.

}
